intro: Allium carinatum var. asperum, commonly known as the rough leaved garlic. This perennial plant is characterized by its robust, fibrous rhizomes and stout, cylindrical bulbs. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and covered with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces clusters of small, pale pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun.
